thread.title: Vandals attack Denver memorial for slain police officer Celena Hollis
thread.title_full: Vandals attack Denver memorial for slain police officer Celena Hollis - The Denver Post

author: Jesse Paul
title: Vandals attack Denver memorial for slain police officer Celena Hollis
text:
A memorial in Denver's City Park for a police officer slain in a 2012 shooting was vandalized last week and investigators are searching for those responsible.
Police say the monument to Officer Celena Hollis was sprayed Oct. 15 with profane graffiti denouncing law enforcement.
Hollis was killed while working on June 24, 2012 , at a City Park Jazz concert. Her killer, Rollin Oliver, pleaded guilty to second-degree murder in the shooting .
Oliver fired his gun randomly into a crowded area, fatally striking Hollis. He was sentenced in June 2013 to 26 years in prison , the maximum penalty.
"We're looking for information about it," Doug Schepman, a police spokesman, said of the vandalism.
In February , protesters spilled red paint on a fallen officer memorial outside of the Denver police headquarters. Two men were arrested and charged in that case.
